titlestmt.titleproper: Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union records, 1880-1990.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday March 28, 2025 at 17:29

did.unittitle: Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union records, 1880-1990.
did.abstract: The first meeting of the Woman's Home Missionary Association was held on November 4, 1879 and the organization was formally chartered on September 28, 1881. The association was founded to support the needs of women and children and was supported by both individual membership and auxiliary groups. The association supported mission-based work in Massachusetts and beyond, especially in the post-war South. After the Massachusetts Congregational Conference merged men's and women's missionary work into the singular Massachusetts Missionary Society in the 1920s, the association was reformed as the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union in 1924. The union continues to operate today. This collection contains the administrative and financial records of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union and includes meeting minutes and reports, correspondence, ledgers, histories, newspaper clippings, and photographs.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union records, 1880-1990, RG0122. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union in May 1982; no accession number. Additional materials were donated by the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union in September 1995; 1995-03.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials in this collection were initially processed in 1996. The collection was reprocessed by Zachary Bodnar, March 2025, adhering to the rules of Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The first meeting of the group that would one day become the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union was held in the vestry of the Park Street Church in Boston on November 4, 1879. The following year, a constitution for the organization of women was adopted and the Woman's Home Missionary Association was formally chartered on September 28, 1881. The association was founded to "promote the spiritual and temporal welfare of those in need, especially women and childrenâ€¦" and the purpose of the association was "to engage all churchwomen in home mission work and to collect money towards that end." The group was supported both by direct membership and by auxiliary organizations, such as the Suffolk Alliance of the Woman's Home Missionary Association, throughout the whole of Massachusetts.

The Woman's Home Missionary Association was successful at raising funds, with annual gifts increasing from $2,500 in the first year to $29,000 in the tenth. The funds were used to support many initiatives and missionaries throughout the years. For example, the association supported Almira Steele's work in the post-war South as the associations first missionary, Lilla Davis and the Cotton Valley School for African-American women in Alabama, the Santee Indian School in Nebraska, the Tuskegee Normal School in Alabama, the Bethlehem Readers Home in Ohio, which later became Schauffler College and eventually Oberlin College, and the French Protestant College in Massachusetts.

The Woman's Home Missionary Association worked closely with the Massachusetts Congregational Conference during the association's early years. Then, in the early 1920s, the Massachusetts Congregational Conference merged the previously separate men's and women's missionary groups into the singular Massachusetts Missionary Society. Due to this merger, a Massachusetts court ordered that the bequests and money held specifically for women and children must be kept separate and administered separately from the Massachusetts Missionary Society. To adhere to this order, the Woman's Home Missionary Association was reorganized as the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union in 1924. By around 1927, many of the auxiliary groups previously associated with the union were moved under the umbrella of the Massachusetts Missionary Society.

The Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union continues to operate today. The union is affiliated with the Southern New England Conferences of the United Church of Christ and annually disburses invested income as grants from an endowment of over $1 million.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the administrative and financial records of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The collection contains board reports and minutes, annual reports, by-laws and related founding documents, correspondence, grant records and correspondence, financial ledgers for internal finances, investments, and named funds, histories and biographies, newspaper clippings, addresses and speeches, and photographs.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been arranged into the five series listed below. Series 2 and series 4 have been further divided into three and six subseries respectively. Series and subseries have been arranged chronologically. Materials within each series and subseries have been arranged in chronological order, generally, and by topic, when warranted.
Subseries 2: Bequest, trust, and gift records, 1892-1967
Series 4: Grant and named fund records, 1896-1990
Subseries 1: Mary W. Hyde and Lucy H. Banister funds records, 1896-1903
Subseries 5: Joseph Hardy and Rosina Towne fund records, 1912-1933

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Materials related to the Suffolk District, the successor organization of the Suffolk Alliance, and other similarly related materials, may be found within the Massachusetts Conference records, 1799-2012, RG5335, held by the Congregational Library & Archives.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: "History." Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. Accessed March 28, 2025. https://www.mwhmu.org/history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the active day-to-day administration of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The series includes annual reports, correspondence, by-laws and other founding documents, documents related to the 1924 name change, secretary records, and insurance documents.

did.unittitle: Suffolk Alliance of the Women's Home Missionary Association records
Rhode Island neighborhood of auxiliaries sepparation

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the internal finances of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The series includes ledgers, correspondence, newspaper clippings, reports, committee minutes, and budgets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records generally related to the finances of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. This subseries includes ledgers, financial reports, budgets, auditors reports, and records of the finance committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to gifts and legacy giving to the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The subseries contains correspondence, newspaper clippings, wills and similar legal documents, ledgers, and a history of legacies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to investments held by the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The records include ledgers, newspaper clippings, reports on investments, lists of securities held, and documents related to stock transactions.

did.unittitle: Chicago, Milwaukee and St. Paul Railway Company clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains histories, biographies, and other documents which document the history of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The series also includes newspaper clippings, anniversary programs, memorials, speaker lists, speeches and addresses, and a congratulatory letter from Jimmy Carter.

did.unittitle: A Brief History of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to how the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union disbursed funds through named funds and scholarships as well as grants. The series includes ledger books, correspondence, and some histories.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Hyde and Lucy H. Banister funds records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains ledger books related to the Mary W. Hyde and Lucy H. Banister funds of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union.

did.unittitle: Mary W. Hyde and Lucy H. Banister funds book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to grants offered by the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The subseries largely includes correspondence but also includes photographs and documents describing the amounts awarded to various benevolent organizations.

did.unittitle: Massachusetts Indian Association grant recipiant photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains ledgers and histories for various and named funds controlled by the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the Travis scholarship fund of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The records include correspondence, photographs, ledgers, and histories.

did.unittitle: Edith Babcock Travis in memoriam book
Joseph Hardy and Rosina Towne fund records

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to Joseph Hardy and Rosina Towne fund of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The subseries includes two fund books.

did.unittitle: Joseph Hardy and Rosina Towne fund book
Joseph Hardy and Rosina Towne fund book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the Golden Anniversary Fund of the Massachusetts Women's Home Missionary Union. The subseries includes correspondence and other materials related to the fund and fundraising.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records by and about the board of directors of the Massachusetts Woman's Home Missionary Union. The series includes board of directors meeting minutes, agendas, officer lists, and the records of a nominating committee.
